contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=April 2010}} [[Image:JonathanArnold.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Jonathan Arnold.]] {{For|the Wisconsin politician|Jonathan Earle Arnold}} '''Jonathan Arnold''' (December 3, 1741 â€“ February 1, 1793) was an American physician and statesman from [[New England]]. He was born in [[Providence, Rhode Island]]. Arnold served in the [[Continental Army]] as a surgeon, and directed the army hospital at Providence. He represented [[Rhode Island]] as a delegate to the [[Continental Congress]] in 1782 and 1783. He moved to a farm in [[St. Johnsbury, Vermont]] in 1787, and later served as a judge. He also served as a clerk in the colony of Rhode Island in 1767. He would write the voucher to the recipient ordering payment from Joseph Clarke Esquire with the General Treasury of the Colony of Rhode Island. ==Descendants== He was the father of [[Lemuel Hastings Arnold]] and great-great-grandfather of [[Theodore Francis Green]]. ==External links== {{Portal box|United States|Rhode Island|Law}} {{CongBio|A000289}} {{Authority control|VIAF=61405807}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Arnold, Jonathan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = December 3, 1741 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Providence, Rhode Island]] | DATE OF DEATH = February 1, 1793 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Arnold, Jonathan}} [[Category:1741 births]] [[Category:1793 deaths]] [[Category:People from Providence, Rhode Island]] [[Category:Vermont state court judges]] [[Category:Continental Congressmen from Rhode Island]] {{US-mil-bio-stub}} {{RhodeIsland-politician-stub}}
